source.5fa88ec9:
According to dataset, it contains three files :
* Train.csv
* Test.csv
* Sample_submission.csv

### Train.csv

This file consists of features for making a good prediction model. 
* Id
* Gender
* Age
* Driving_License
* Region_Code
* Previously_Insured
* Vehicle_Age
* Vehicle_Damage
* Annual_Premium
* Policy_Sales_Channel
* Vintage
* Response

**Note : Response is what we have to predict ("Remember")**

### Test.csv

This file also same as Train.csv but one differnce. You know it is a test file and response is a predictable feature of dataset so we have only other features than Response. So Just we have to test it.

### Sample_Submission.csv

This file consists of submission so **In my Opinion, we should not look into it beacuse it is a solution of that which column has greater importances of predicting the Response of dataset.** Others, it is upto you guys.

source.d3ba3330:
Hey folks👋👋, **Happy Machine Learning**.

Today we are going to discuss about Health insurance cross sell prediction. So Fisrt Question in your mind ( who are beginner ) is What is this 🤔🤔?????

OH, No need to worry guys, it is as simple as that just know about this and Boom 💥💥.

This statement is given by a Kaggler whose dataset link here : https://www.kaggle.com/anmolkumar/health-insurance-cross-sell-prediction

**Our client is an Insurance company that has provided Health Insurance to its customers now they need your help in building a model to predict whether the policyholders (customers) from past year will also be interested in Vehicle Insurance provided by the company.**


**Building a model to predict whether a customer would be interested in Vehicle Insurance is extremely helpful for the company because it can then accordingly plan its communication strategy to reach out to those customers and optimise its business model and revenue.**

**Now, in order to predict, whether the customer would be interested in Vehicle insurance, you have information about demographics (gender, age, region code type), Vehicles (Vehicle Age, Damage), Policy (Premium, sourcing channel) etc.**

**RoadMap :** 
            So we have to analyze the statement first and then look into the dataset then choose what we have to do for making model, do some preprocessing etc.
            

Here we go ::::::::::::::::

So now we have our X variable(important feature) and y variable(predictable part) so we are going forward to  make our model. 

What are your suggestion guys ???????????

Okay Okay, as we all know it is a classification problem that classify 0 and 1 so what we are going to do with it is choosing a sklearn classification problem (**Simple Machine Learning**). 

**Note : It is also done by Deep learning too. As it is a classification prob so we can do it by applying keras and make a network of that. Make sense ??**

Yes, It's okay. But for now we going to make this by just a simple Machine Learning Algorithm like Decision Tree, Random Forest etc.

Here we are going to use a **Decision Tree Clasifier** So whati is Decision Tree if you don't know go through this link https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.tree.DecisionTreeClassifier.html
